# NSCoder.DecodingFailurePolicy.setErrorAndReturn

**Case**

A failure policy that directs the coder to capture the failure as an error object.

## Declaration

```swift
case setErrorAndReturn
```

## Discussion

On decode failure, the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSCoder] will capture the failure as an [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSError], and prevent further decodes (by returning `0` / `nil` equivalent as appropriate).

Use this policy if you know that all encoded objects use [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSCoder/failWithError(_:)] to communicate decode failures and don’t raise exceptions for error propagation.

## Failure Policies

- **NSCoder.DecodingFailurePolicy.raiseException**: A failure policy that directs the coder to raise an exception.
